newsArray.title: Surrey close on title as rivals Essex beaten by Liam Dawson-inspired Hampshire
newsArray.description: The reigning champions are 20 points clear of second-placed Essex heading into the final round of fixtures.
newsArray.content: Continuing an outstanding season, Dawson made 119, contributing to a fifth-wicket stand of 184 alongside James Vince as they took the game away from second-placed Essex at Chelmsford. Dawson had come to the crease with Hampshire, set 267 for victory, having been reduced to 32 for four but went on to make his third century of the season while Vince made 89. Match drawn ðŸ¤ A brilliant effort from the opening pair who take the applause of the crowd for the last time at The Kia Oval this year. Surrey take 8 points from the match and will head to the Ageas Bowl next week for the last game of the year. ðŸ¤Ž | â€” Surrey Cricket (@surreycricket) It means Essex will go into their final fixture 20 points behind reigning champions Surrey, who held on to draw against winless Northamptonshire at the Kia Oval. With relegation looking inevitable, Northamptonshire gambled against the leaders as they enforced the follow on with a first-innings lead of 172, but they could not make it pay. Surrey openers Dom Sibley and Rory Burns batted diligently in the hour before lunch against some testing new-ball bowling from the visting seamers and throughout the final two sessions in some of the best batting conditions of a rain-affected four days. By the time bad light brought about an early close, they had reached 142 without loss, with Burns on 71 and Sibley 67. Relegation-battling Kent salvaged a draw from their rain-hit match against Somerset after being made to follow on at Taunton. Northamptonshire's draw leaves them 24 points behind eighth-placed Middlesex. As it stands, Northamptonshire are mathematically unable to avoid relegation, barring any unforeseen final-round points deductions â€” LV= Insurance County Championship (@CountyChamp) The visitors were bowled out for 235 in their first innings, 169 shy of Somersetâ€™s total, after being reduced to 31 for four before Joe Denly pitched in with 73. Somerset put them back in with the hope of some quick wickets with a possible 41 overs remaining, but Kent made it to 44 for two before the players shook hands early. The draw was enough to put Kent one point above Middlesex, who dropped into the bottom two after an eight-wicket defeat to Warwickshire. Opener Sam Robson carried his bat for an unbeaten century but it was not enough for the hosts, who were bowled out for 251 in their second innings. The winning moment! ðŸ˜ ðŸ» | â€” Warwickshire CCC ðŸ (@WarwickshireCCC) Following afternoon rain, Warwickshire had only 10 overs in which to chase 58, but Rob Yates and Ed Barnard made it across the line with nine balls to spare. There was an early end to play at Old Trafford where rain forced a draw between Lancashire and Nottinghamshire. There were only 15 overs played on the final day, with Lancashire reaching 272 for seven in their first innings. But with Nottinghamshire yet to bat there was never any prospect of a result. In Division Two, Worcestershire moved within touching distance of following Durham into Division One after their match with the newly-crowned champions ended in a draw. ðŸŒ¦ï¸ The game ends in a draw and we take eight points. â€” Worcestershire CCC (@WorcsCCC) With a result out of the question, Worcestershire were restricted to adding one bowling point as Durham captain Scott Borthwick made a chanceless century and Ollie Robinson contributed 84 to a first innings score of 371 for four at the close. Worcestershire go into the final week as strong favourites to go up after closest challengers Leicestershire saw their match against Yorkshire ruined by the weather. More rain on the final day robbed Leicestershire of the chance to chase the win they realistically needed to stay in the hunt. It also finished as a draw between Derbyshire and Sussex after rain brought about an early finish at the County Ground.

newsArray.title: I love to put myself in challenging situations, says KL Rahul after playing role of finisher in India's win
newsArray.description: Rahul said it was imperative to build a partnership with Suryakumar Yadav (50) once the set Shubman Gill (74) and Ruturaj Gaikwad (71) departed. MOHALI: India's stand-in captain KL Rahul believes it is always good to put himself in "challenging situations", especially after returning from a long injury lay-off. Leading the side in the first two ODIs against Australia in absence of Rohit Sharma, Rahul struck an unbeaten 58 as India won by five wickets to take a 1-0 lead in the three-match dress rehearsal series before the World Cup. "Not the first time, always happens with me. I'm used to it, I love it," Rahul said about leading the side in place of regular skipper Rohit Sharma. "I think the intensity in the afternoon was great, after Colombo this felt like heaven at the start but it was really hot and humid. It gets tough and physically challenging, but we've all worked on our fitness and that's showing on the field." Rahul said it was imperative to build a partnership with Suryakumar Yadav (50) once the set Shubman Gill (74) and Ruturaj Gaikwad (71) departed. "After Shubman got out, it was a bit tricky with the set batter out. But managed to build a good partnership with Surya, need to put myself in such challenging situations. We kept talking about hitting good cricket shots, rotating the strike and this is something all our batters are working on. We didn't want to get bogged down, we were always on par so we wanted to take it deep," he said. Man-of-the-match Mohammed Shami, who returned with a brilliant 5 for 51, felt good after bowling his full quota of 10 overs on Friday in hot and humid conditions. "It depends on the captain and the game situation, but despite the heat you feel like bowling 4-5 overs with the new ball," Shami said of bowling longer spells in the sultry conditions. "I enjoyed the wicket of Marsh, that's a different feeling when you get the outside edge, when you control your swing nicely. It was important to hit the right lengths on this wicket, either at full pace or go slow, but bowling the right lengths were key," he said. Australia captain Pat Cummins said it was not an overall performance from his injury-ridden side but hoped the series would help them to build a good rhythm in the run-up to the ODI World Cup starting in India next month. "Personally, happy to be back. Good to get my first game in India. A few guys batted well, few guys bowled well but overall not good enough. (On injuries) They'd probably not be ready for the second game, maybe the third game. Maxi (Glenn Maxwell) has just arrived in India. (Steve) Smith's first hit as well, and Davey (David Warner) was brilliant," he said. "Good to see them out there together. We've got one eye on the big tournament, but you want to set the standards early and build a good rhythm," he added.

newsArray.title: India beat Australia in first ODI to top ICC rankings across formats
creator: A Sports
newsArray.description: Hosts India on Friday became the number one ODI side after beating Australia in the opening game of the three-match series. India had headed into the ODI series against Australia on the back of their Asia Cup 2023 win. It was Australiaâ€™s fourth consecutive ODI. They headed in the series on the back of 2-3 [â€¦] The post India beat Australia in first ODI to top ICC rankings across formats appeared first on ASports.tv.
newsArray.content: Hosts India on Friday became the number one ODI side after beating Australia in the opening game of the three-match series. India had headed into the ODI series against Australia on the back of their Asia Cup 2023 win. It was Australiaâ€™s fourth consecutive ODI. They headed in the series on the back of 2-3 series defeat to hosts South Africa. The visitors, sent to bat first, scored 276 in their 50 overs. Opener David Warner helped the cause with his half-centuries. He top-scored with 52 off 53 balls with six boundaries and two maximums to his name. Wicketkeeper Josh Inglis and Steve Smith â€“ who returned to the side after recovering from wrist injury â€“ scored 45 and 41 respectively. Mohammed Shami was the pick of the pacers with his superb figures of 5-51 in 10 overs. India successfully chased the 277-run target in 48.4 overs. Opener Shubman Gill top-scored 74 from 63 balls with six fours and two maximums. His opening partner scored 10 boundaries on his way to 77-ball 71. They put on a 142-run opening partnership. KL Rahul went unbeaten at 58 off 63 deliveries with four boundaries and a maximum to his name, while Suryakumar Yadav hit five fours and a maximum on his way to 49-ball 50. Australia spinner Adam Zampa bagged two wickets. READ: ICC unveils schedule for U19 Menâ€™s Cricket World Cup 2024

newsArray.title: India Displace Pakistan as No 1 Ranked ODI Team, Attain Top Spot in All Formats After Victory Over Australia
newsArray.description: The Men in Blue were at their best in the first game of the three-match ODI series on September 22 in Mohali and defeated Australia by five wickets to gain a series lead.
newsArray.content: India took the stage alongside Australia in the first game of the three-match ODI series on September 22 in Mohali. The Men in Blue were at their best and defeated Australia by five wickets to gain a series lead. With the win, India has also pipped Pakistan to reclaim the top spot in ICC Men's ODI Rankings. Moreover, Men in Blue have scripted history by becoming the number one side in all three formats. Mohammed Shami Scripts His Best-Ever Bowling Figures in ODIs As India Beat Australia by Five Wickets in 1st ODI, Take 1â€“0 Series Lead . newsArray.title: Surrey close on title as rivals Essex beaten by Liam Dawson-inspired Hampshire
newsArray.description: The reigning champions are 20 points clear of second-placed Essex heading into the final round of fixtures.
newsArray.content: Continuing an outstanding season, Dawson made 119, contributing to a fifth-wicket stand of 184 alongside James Vince as they took the game away from second-placed Essex at Chelmsford. Dawson had come to the crease with Hampshire, set 267 for victory, having been reduced to 32 for four but went on to make his third century of the season while Vince made 89. Match drawn ðŸ¤ A brilliant effort from the opening pair who take the applause of the crowd for the last time at The Kia Oval this year. Surrey take 8 points from the match and will head to the Ageas Bowl next week for the last game of the year. ðŸ¤Ž | â€” Surrey Cricket (@surreycricket) It means Essex will go into their final fixture 20 points behind reigning champions Surrey, who held on to draw against winless Northamptonshire at the Kia Oval. With relegation looking inevitable, Northamptonshire gambled against the leaders as they enforced the follow on with a first-innings lead of 172, but they could not make it pay. Surrey openers Dom Sibley and Rory Burns batted diligently in the hour before lunch against some testing new-ball bowling from the visting seamers and throughout the final two sessions in some of the best batting conditions of a rain-affected four days. By the time bad light brought about an early close, they had reached 142 without loss, with Burns on 71 and Sibley 67. Relegation-battling Kent salvaged a draw from their rain-hit match against Somerset after being made to follow on at Taunton. Northamptonshire's draw leaves them 24 points behind eighth-placed Middlesex. As it stands, Northamptonshire are mathematically unable to avoid relegation, barring any unforeseen final-round points deductions â€” LV= Insurance County Championship (@CountyChamp) The visitors were bowled out for 235 in their first innings, 169 shy of Somersetâ€™s total, after being reduced to 31 for four before Joe Denly pitched in with 73. Somerset put them back in with the hope of some quick wickets with a possible 41 overs remaining, but Kent made it to 44 for two before the players shook hands early. The draw was enough to put Kent one point above Middlesex, who dropped into the bottom two after an eight-wicket defeat to Warwickshire. Opener Sam Robson carried his bat for an unbeaten century but it was not enough for the hosts, who were bowled out for 251 in their second innings. The winning moment! ðŸ˜ ðŸ» | â€” Warwickshire CCC ðŸ (@WarwickshireCCC) Following afternoon rain, Warwickshire had only 10 overs in which to chase 58, but Rob Yates and Ed Barnard made it across the line with nine balls to spare. There was an early end to play at Old Trafford where rain forced a draw between Lancashire and Nottinghamshire. There were only 15 overs played on the final day, with Lancashire reaching 272 for seven in their first innings. But with Nottinghamshire yet to bat there was never any prospect of a result. In Division Two, Worcestershire moved within touching distance of following Durham into Division One after their match with the newly-crowned champions ended in a draw. ðŸŒ¦ï¸ The game ends in a draw and we take eight points. â€” Worcestershire CCC (@WorcsCCC) With a result out of the question, Worcestershire were restricted to adding one bowling point as Durham captain Scott Borthwick made a chanceless century and Ollie Robinson contributed 84 to a first innings score of 371 for four at the close. Worcestershire go into the final week as strong favourites to go up after closest challengers Leicestershire saw their match against Yorkshire ruined by the weather. More rain on the final day robbed Leicestershire of the chance to chase the win they realistically needed to stay in the hunt. It also finished as a draw between Derbyshire and Sussex after rain brought about an early finish at the County Ground.

newsArray.title: I love to put myself in challenging situations, says KL Rahul after playing role of finisher in India's win
newsArray.description: Rahul said it was imperative to build a partnership with Suryakumar Yadav (50) once the set Shubman Gill (74) and Ruturaj Gaikwad (71) departed. MOHALI: India's stand-in captain KL Rahul believes it is always good to put himself in "challenging situations", especially after returning from a long injury lay-off. Leading the side in the first two ODIs against Australia in absence of Rohit Sharma, Rahul struck an unbeaten 58 as India won by five wickets to take a 1-0 lead in the three-match dress rehearsal series before the World Cup. "Not the first time, always happens with me. I'm used to it, I love it," Rahul said about leading the side in place of regular skipper Rohit Sharma. "I think the intensity in the afternoon was great, after Colombo this felt like heaven at the start but it was really hot and humid. It gets tough and physically challenging, but we've all worked on our fitness and that's showing on the field." Rahul said it was imperative to build a partnership with Suryakumar Yadav (50) once the set Shubman Gill (74) and Ruturaj Gaikwad (71) departed. "After Shubman got out, it was a bit tricky with the set batter out. But managed to build a good partnership with Surya, need to put myself in such challenging situations. We kept talking about hitting good cricket shots, rotating the strike and this is something all our batters are working on. We didn't want to get bogged down, we were always on par so we wanted to take it deep," he said. Man-of-the-match Mohammed Shami, who returned with a brilliant 5 for 51, felt good after bowling his full quota of 10 overs on Friday in hot and humid conditions. "It depends on the captain and the game situation, but despite the heat you feel like bowling 4-5 overs with the new ball," Shami said of bowling longer spells in the sultry conditions. "I enjoyed the wicket of Marsh, that's a different feeling when you get the outside edge, when you control your swing nicely. It was important to hit the right lengths on this wicket, either at full pace or go slow, but bowling the right lengths were key," he said. Australia captain Pat Cummins said it was not an overall performance from his injury-ridden side but hoped the series would help them to build a good rhythm in the run-up to the ODI World Cup starting in India next month. "Personally, happy to be back. Good to get my first game in India. A few guys batted well, few guys bowled well but overall not good enough. (On injuries) They'd probably not be ready for the second game, maybe the third game. Maxi (Glenn Maxwell) has just arrived in India. (Steve) Smith's first hit as well, and Davey (David Warner) was brilliant," he said. "Good to see them out there together. We've got one eye on the big tournament, but you want to set the standards early and build a good rhythm," he added.

newsArray.title: India beat Australia in first ODI to top ICC rankings across formats
creator: A Sports
newsArray.description: Hosts India on Friday became the number one ODI side after beating Australia in the opening game of the three-match series. India had headed into the ODI series against Australia on the back of their Asia Cup 2023 win. It was Australiaâ€™s fourth consecutive ODI. They headed in the series on the back of 2-3 [â€¦] The post India beat Australia in first ODI to top ICC rankings across formats appeared first on ASports.tv.
newsArray.content: Hosts India on Friday became the number one ODI side after beating Australia in the opening game of the three-match series. India had headed into the ODI series against Australia on the back of their Asia Cup 2023 win. It was Australiaâ€™s fourth consecutive ODI. They headed in the series on the back of 2-3 series defeat to hosts South Africa. The visitors, sent to bat first, scored 276 in their 50 overs. Opener David Warner helped the cause with his half-centuries. He top-scored with 52 off 53 balls with six boundaries and two maximums to his name. Wicketkeeper Josh Inglis and Steve Smith â€“ who returned to the side after recovering from wrist injury â€“ scored 45 and 41 respectively. Mohammed Shami was the pick of the pacers with his superb figures of 5-51 in 10 overs. India successfully chased the 277-run target in 48.4 overs. Opener Shubman Gill top-scored 74 from 63 balls with six fours and two maximums. His opening partner scored 10 boundaries on his way to 77-ball 71. They put on a 142-run opening partnership. KL Rahul went unbeaten at 58 off 63 deliveries with four boundaries and a maximum to his name, while Suryakumar Yadav hit five fours and a maximum on his way to 49-ball 50. Australia spinner Adam Zampa bagged two wickets. READ: ICC unveils schedule for U19 Menâ€™s Cricket World Cup 2024

newsArray.title: India Displace Pakistan as No 1 Ranked ODI Team, Attain Top Spot in All Formats After Victory Over Australia
newsArray.description: The Men in Blue were at their best in the first game of the three-match ODI series on September 22 in Mohali and defeated Australia by five wickets to gain a series lead.
newsArray.content: India took the stage alongside Australia in the first game of the three-match ODI series on September 22 in Mohali. The Men in Blue were at their best and defeated Australia by five wickets to gain a series lead. With the win, India has also pipped Pakistan to reclaim the top spot in ICC Men's ODI Rankings. Moreover, Men in Blue have scripted history by becoming the number one side in all three formats. Mohammed Shami Scripts His Best-Ever Bowling Figures in ODIs As India Beat Australia by Five Wickets in 1st ODI, Take 1â€“0 Series Lead . India Displace Pakistan as No 1 Ranked ODI Team, Attain Top Spot in All Formats After Victory Over Australia ðŸš¨ BREAKING: India script rankings history by achieving rare feat after victory in first ODI against Australia! #INDvAUS | Details ðŸ‘‡ â€” ICC (@ICC) September 22, 2023 (SocialLY brings you all the latest breaking news, viral trends and information from social media world, including Twitter, Instagram and Youtube. newsArray.title: Surrey close on title as rivals Essex beaten by Liam Dawson-inspired Hampshire
newsArray.description: The reigning champions are 20 points clear of second-placed Essex heading into the final round of fixtures.
newsArray.content: Continuing an outstanding season, Dawson made 119, contributing to a fifth-wicket stand of 184 alongside James Vince as they took the game away from second-placed Essex at Chelmsford. Dawson had come to the crease with Hampshire, set 267 for victory, having been reduced to 32 for four but went on to make his third century of the season while Vince made 89. Match drawn ðŸ¤ A brilliant effort from the opening pair who take the applause of the crowd for the last time at The Kia Oval this year. Surrey take 8 points from the match and will head to the Ageas Bowl next week for the last game of the year. ðŸ¤Ž | â€” Surrey Cricket (@surreycricket) It means Essex will go into their final fixture 20 points behind reigning champions Surrey, who held on to draw against winless Northamptonshire at the Kia Oval. With relegation looking inevitable, Northamptonshire gambled against the leaders as they enforced the follow on with a first-innings lead of 172, but they could not make it pay. Surrey openers Dom Sibley and Rory Burns batted diligently in the hour before lunch against some testing new-ball bowling from the visting seamers and throughout the final two sessions in some of the best batting conditions of a rain-affected four days. By the time bad light brought about an early close, they had reached 142 without loss, with Burns on 71 and Sibley 67. Relegation-battling Kent salvaged a draw from their rain-hit match against Somerset after being made to follow on at Taunton. Northamptonshire's draw leaves them 24 points behind eighth-placed Middlesex. As it stands, Northamptonshire are mathematically unable to avoid relegation, barring any unforeseen final-round points deductions â€” LV= Insurance County Championship (@CountyChamp) The visitors were bowled out for 235 in their first innings, 169 shy of Somersetâ€™s total, after being reduced to 31 for four before Joe Denly pitched in with 73. Somerset put them back in with the hope of some quick wickets with a possible 41 overs remaining, but Kent made it to 44 for two before the players shook hands early. The draw was enough to put Kent one point above Middlesex, who dropped into the bottom two after an eight-wicket defeat to Warwickshire. Opener Sam Robson carried his bat for an unbeaten century but it was not enough for the hosts, who were bowled out for 251 in their second innings. The winning moment! ðŸ˜ ðŸ» | â€” Warwickshire CCC ðŸ (@WarwickshireCCC) Following afternoon rain, Warwickshire had only 10 overs in which to chase 58, but Rob Yates and Ed Barnard made it across the line with nine balls to spare. There was an early end to play at Old Trafford where rain forced a draw between Lancashire and Nottinghamshire. There were only 15 overs played on the final day, with Lancashire reaching 272 for seven in their first innings. But with Nottinghamshire yet to bat there was never any prospect of a result. In Division Two, Worcestershire moved within touching distance of following Durham into Division One after their match with the newly-crowned champions ended in a draw. ðŸŒ¦ï¸ The game ends in a draw and we take eight points. â€” Worcestershire CCC (@WorcsCCC) With a result out of the question, Worcestershire were restricted to adding one bowling point as Durham captain Scott Borthwick made a chanceless century and Ollie Robinson contributed 84 to a first innings score of 371 for four at the close. Worcestershire go into the final week as strong favourites to go up after closest challengers Leicestershire saw their match against Yorkshire ruined by the weather. More rain on the final day robbed Leicestershire of the chance to chase the win they realistically needed to stay in the hunt. It also finished as a draw between Derbyshire and Sussex after rain brought about an early finish at the County Ground.

newsArray.title: I love to put myself in challenging situations, says KL Rahul after playing role of finisher in India's win
newsArray.description: Rahul said it was imperative to build a partnership with Suryakumar Yadav (50) once the set Shubman Gill (74) and Ruturaj Gaikwad (71) departed. MOHALI: India's stand-in captain KL Rahul believes it is always good to put himself in "challenging situations", especially after returning from a long injury lay-off. Leading the side in the first two ODIs against Australia in absence of Rohit Sharma, Rahul struck an unbeaten 58 as India won by five wickets to take a 1-0 lead in the three-match dress rehearsal series before the World Cup. "Not the first time, always happens with me. I'm used to it, I love it," Rahul said about leading the side in place of regular skipper Rohit Sharma. "I think the intensity in the afternoon was great, after Colombo this felt like heaven at the start but it was really hot and humid. It gets tough and physically challenging, but we've all worked on our fitness and that's showing on the field." Rahul said it was imperative to build a partnership with Suryakumar Yadav (50) once the set Shubman Gill (74) and Ruturaj Gaikwad (71) departed. "After Shubman got out, it was a bit tricky with the set batter out. But managed to build a good partnership with Surya, need to put myself in such challenging situations. We kept talking about hitting good cricket shots, rotating the strike and this is something all our batters are working on. We didn't want to get bogged down, we were always on par so we wanted to take it deep," he said. Man-of-the-match Mohammed Shami, who returned with a brilliant 5 for 51, felt good after bowling his full quota of 10 overs on Friday in hot and humid conditions. "It depends on the captain and the game situation, but despite the heat you feel like bowling 4-5 overs with the new ball," Shami said of bowling longer spells in the sultry conditions. "I enjoyed the wicket of Marsh, that's a different feeling when you get the outside edge, when you control your swing nicely. It was important to hit the right lengths on this wicket, either at full pace or go slow, but bowling the right lengths were key," he said. Australia captain Pat Cummins said it was not an overall performance from his injury-ridden side but hoped the series would help them to build a good rhythm in the run-up to the ODI World Cup starting in India next month. "Personally, happy to be back. Good to get my first game in India. A few guys batted well, few guys bowled well but overall not good enough. (On injuries) They'd probably not be ready for the second game, maybe the third game. Maxi (Glenn Maxwell) has just arrived in India. (Steve) Smith's first hit as well, and Davey (David Warner) was brilliant," he said. "Good to see them out there together. We've got one eye on the big tournament, but you want to set the standards early and build a good rhythm," he added.

newsArray.title: India beat Australia in first ODI to top ICC rankings across formats
creator: A Sports
newsArray.description: Hosts India on Friday became the number one ODI side after beating Australia in the opening game of the three-match series. India had headed into the ODI series against Australia on the back of their Asia Cup 2023 win. It was Australiaâ€™s fourth consecutive ODI. They headed in the series on the back of 2-3 [â€¦] The post India beat Australia in first ODI to top ICC rankings across formats appeared first on ASports.tv.
newsArray.content: Hosts India on Friday became the number one ODI side after beating Australia in the opening game of the three-match series. India had headed into the ODI series against Australia on the back of their Asia Cup 2023 win. It was Australiaâ€™s fourth consecutive ODI. They headed in the series on the back of 2-3 series defeat to hosts South Africa. The visitors, sent to bat first, scored 276 in their 50 overs. Opener David Warner helped the cause with his half-centuries. He top-scored with 52 off 53 balls with six boundaries and two maximums to his name. Wicketkeeper Josh Inglis and Steve Smith â€“ who returned to the side after recovering from wrist injury â€“ scored 45 and 41 respectively. Mohammed Shami was the pick of the pacers with his superb figures of 5-51 in 10 overs. India successfully chased the 277-run target in 48.4 overs. Opener Shubman Gill top-scored 74 from 63 balls with six fours and two maximums. His opening partner scored 10 boundaries on his way to 77-ball 71. They put on a 142-run opening partnership. KL Rahul went unbeaten at 58 off 63 deliveries with four boundaries and a maximum to his name, while Suryakumar Yadav hit five fours and a maximum on his way to 49-ball 50. Australia spinner Adam Zampa bagged two wickets. READ: ICC unveils schedule for U19 Menâ€™s Cricket World Cup 2024

newsArray.title: India Displace Pakistan as No 1 Ranked ODI Team, Attain Top Spot in All Formats After Victory Over Australia
newsArray.description: The Men in Blue were at their best in the first game of the three-match ODI series on September 22 in Mohali and defeated Australia by five wickets to gain a series lead.
newsArray.content: India took the stage alongside Australia in the first game of the three-match ODI series on September 22 in Mohali. The Men in Blue were at their best and defeated Australia by five wickets to gain a series lead. With the win, India has also pipped Pakistan to reclaim the top spot in ICC Men's ODI Rankings. Moreover, Men in Blue have scripted history by becoming the number one side in all three formats. Mohammed Shami Scripts His Best-Ever Bowling Figures in ODIs As India Beat Australia by Five Wickets in 1st ODI, Take 1â€“0 Series Lead . India Displace Pakistan as No 1 Ranked ODI Team, Attain Top Spot in All Formats After Victory Over Australia ðŸš¨ BREAKING: India script rankings history by achieving rare feat after victory in first ODI against Australia! #INDvAUS | Details ðŸ‘‡ â€” ICC (@ICC) September 22, 2023 (SocialLY brings you all the latest breaking news, viral trends and information from social media world, including Twitter, Instagram and Youtube.
